inputs.description: A list of YAML or JSON strings that will be merged into the `output` attribute. Inputs are processed in order.

output.description: The deep-merged `output`, rendered in YAML or JSON, according to configuration.

format.description: Specify the type of input and output that the merger will be dealing with. Allowed values are: "JSON" or "YAML".

with_append_slice.description: Specify whether the merger should append slices instead of overwriting it. This implicitly overrides the `with_slice_deep_copy` behaviour. Defaults to `false`.

with_override.description: Specify whether the merger should override non-empty current-level attributes with non-empty next-level attributes values. Defaults to `true`.

with_overwrite_with_empty_value.description: Specify whether the merger should override non empty current-level attributes with empty next-level attributes values. This implicitly enables the `with_override` flag. Defaults to `false`.

with_slice_deep_copy.description: Specify whether the merger should merge slice element one by one. This implicitly enables the `with_override` flag. Defaults to `false`.

block.description: The merger configuration. Refer to https://github.com/imdario/mergo for more details regarding configuration behaviours.
The `deep_merge` data source accepts a list of JSON or YAML strings as input and deep merges into a single output, based on the configured merge rules.
